longDefinition: Māshrā is a Suryānī word which literally means acute inflammation of any part of body due to predominance of Dam (blood/sanguine) and Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile). Ancient Unani physicians have used this word for the inflammation of face and forehead. Ibn Sīnā had included this term for the acute inflammation of liver which is caused exclusively by the predominance of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile). But most recent Unani physicians describe this as an acute inflammation of face and forehead in which the face becomes red and swollen accompanied with pain and itching.

longDefinition: Accumulation of fluid in the head. This can be of two types, either the accumulation is beneath the scalp or inside the head. If it occurs inside the head, the patient experiences heaviness of head, eyes remain open with continuous lacrimation and this is usually a fatal condition. When the fluid is accumulated beneath the scalp due to bad obstetric procedure, it is usually curable and subsides gradually (caput succeedenum).

longDefinition: It is considered as an inflammation of conjunctiva of eye which is Ḥārr (acute) in nature. Sometimes only the pain of eyes is known as Ramad. In this condition eyelids become swollen, eyes become red with continuous watering.

longDefinition: It is a type of Ramad caused by the predominance of Dam (sanguine) in the surrounding areas of brain and its infiltration into eyes. It is characterized by redness of eyes, swelling, engorgement of vessels of eyes, temporal region of face, pulsation at temporal region, decreased lacrimation and purulent discharge.

longDefinition: A type of Ramad caused by the predominance of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) and its infiltration into the area surrounding the eye. It is characterized by severe pain from the beginning, pricking sensation, excessive lacrimation but comparatively less redness in the eyes.
searchableText: ramad shafrawi رمد صفراوی bilious conjunctivitis a type of ramad caused by the predominance of ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) and its infiltration into the area surrounding the eye. it is characterized by severe pain from the beginning, pricking sensation, excessive lacrimation but comparatively less redness in the eyes.

longDefinition: A type of Ramad caused by excessive intake of milk and other diets that produce phlegm. It is also associated with extreme cold condition and catarrh. In this condition, eyes appear to be wet with little redness, pain and discharge.
searchableText: ramad balghami رمد بلغمی phlegmatic conjunctivitis a type of ramad caused by excessive intake of milk and other diets that produce phlegm. it is also associated with extreme cold condition and catarrh. in this condition, eyes appear to be wet with little redness, pain and discharge.

longDefinition: A type of Ramad caused by dryness of temperament as a result of excessive intake of black bile producing diets. It is characterized by dryness and discoloration of eyes with decreased lacrimation and less stickiness of eyes. It is a long lasting condition.
searchableText: ramad sawdawi رمد سوداوی melancholic conjunctivitis a type of ramad caused by dryness of temperament as a result of excessive intake of black bile producing diets. it is characterized by dryness and discoloration of eyes with decreased lacrimation and less stickiness of eyes. it is a long lasting condition.

longDefinition: A type of Ramad accompanied with lacrimation and shifting pain. It is caused by accumulation of thick vapours coming from the brain towards conjunctiva. In this condition there is distension and radiation of pain towards the head, eyes and face.
searchableText: ramad rihi رمد ریحی gaseous conjunctivitis a type of ramad accompanied with lacrimation and shifting pain. it is caused by accumulation of thick vapours coming from the brain towards conjunctiva. in this condition there is distension and radiation of pain towards the head, eyes and face.

longDefinition: Inflammation of conjunctiva which appears as a hard white nodule due to accumulation of phlegm. It resembles fat in its colour but not in consistency. longDefinition: False perception of images or objects which actually do not exist. This is due to congestion of morbid humours in brain and nerves. These include: 1. longDefinition: The intolerance of light by eyes. It may be caused either by conditions of the eye itself e.g. corneal ulcers, uveitis, kerato conjunctivitis etc. or by some cranial disorders e.g. migraine, trigeminal neuralgia, etc.

longDefinition: Bad odour from the nose. Its causes may be nasal polyps, ulcers of nose, injury to the nose, foreign body in the nose, glossitis, dental caries and stomatitis. longDefinition: Its literal meaning is choking. It is an inflammation of external pharynx and larynx or muscles of upper part of oesophagus. The condition leads to difficulty in breathing and swallowing. Depending on the humours involved it is divided into four types i.e. Khunāq Damawī (sanguineous), Ṣafrāwī (bilious), Sawdāwī (melancholic), and Balghamī (phlegmatic).

nativeScript: خناق وبائي/ ورم الحنجرة حادغشائي/ خناقي

longDefinition: Literal meaning of Suqūṭ is “to drop or fall”. In this condition uvula becomes flaccid and hangs loosely in the throat. Patient feels a foreign body sensation in the throat. On examination the elongated uvula can be seen easily. Sometimes it becomes so elongated that the patient feels difficulty in swallowing the food and coughs frequently. It is caused either due to the predominance of blood or phlegm in the body.

longDefinition: It is the inflammation of uvula caused by predominance of sanguine, yellow bile, phlegm or black bile. Most often it occurs due to infiltration of catarrhal fluids from head in to it.

longDefinition: A condition where ulceration or fever is absent but patient suffers from cold and cough.

longDefinition: Coughing out pus due to any reason.

longDefinition: Its literal meaning is ‘pain of ribs’. According to humour it is of four types: Damawī (sanguineous), Balghamī (phlegmatic), Ṣafrāwī (bilious) and Sawdāwī (melancholic).

term: Dhāt al-Janb Ḥaqīqī/ Dhāt al-Janb Khāliṣ

nativeScript: ذات الجنب غير حقيقي/ ذات الجنب غير خالص

longDefinition: Pain of intercostal muscles accompanied with fever, syncope, cough and foul breath. Death occurs with in days in this type.

longDefinition: A condition of breathlessness occurring in children. It is caused by the phlegmatic humours in the body. On inspection there is a bulge at the base of ribs on respiration. It is accompanied with fever, cough etc.

longDefinition: Its literal meaning is to cry. In this condition, child cries a lot while coughing severely.

longDefinition: Dilatation of the bronchial tubes. It is an abnormal permanent dilatation of the bronchi marked by foetid breath and paroxysmal coughing with muco purulent discharge.

searchableText: iltihab al-shu‘ab ḥadd التهاب الشعب حاد acute bronchitis a type of inflammation of bronchi with a short and severe course. it is due to the exposure to cold and some irritant substances. it is characterized by fever, chest pain, dyspnoea, etc.

longDefinition: A condition caused by an inadequate supply of blood and oxygen to a portion of myocardium.

longDefinition: A condition that occurs due to loss of supply of blood in a part of muscle of heart or due to occlusion in the coronary artery or its branches.

longDefinition: A decrease of flow of blood through coronary arteries.

longDefinition: A slow sinus rhythm with a heart rate of less than 60 per minute.
searchableText: buṭu’ al-qalb al-jaybi بطوء القلب الجيبي sinus bradycardia a slow sinus rhythm with a heart rate of less than 60 per minute.

longDefinition: A fast sinus rhythm with a heart rate of more than 100 per minute. It is seen in fevers, shock, thyrotoxicosis, pericarditis, congenital heart disease, anaemia, etc.
searchableText: sur‘a al-qalb al-jaybiyya سرعة القلب الجيبية sinus tachycardia a fast sinus rhythm with a heart rate of more than 100 per minute. it is seen in fevers, shock, thyrotoxicosis, pericarditis, congenital heart disease, anaemia, etc.

longDefinition: A premature contraction of heart that is independent of the normal rhythm and arises in response to an impulse in some part of the heart other than sino atrial node. It is usually seen in myocardial infarction.
searchableText: za’id inqibaḍat زائد انقباضا ت ectopic beats/extra systole a premature contraction of heart that is independent of the normal rhythm and arises in response to an impulse in some part of the heart other than sino atrial node. it is usually seen in myocardial infarction.

longDefinition: An atrial arrhythmia characterized by rapid randomized contractions of the atrial myocardium causing a totally irregular often rapid ventricular rate.
searchableText: irti‘ash udhuni ارتعاش اذني atrial fibrillation an atrial arrhythmia characterized by rapid randomized contractions of the atrial myocardium causing a totally irregular often rapid ventricular rate.

longDefinition: It is seen in young and middle aged persons. Its common complication is mitral valve disease.
searchableText: maraḍ al-qalb al-ḥudari مرض القلب الحداري rheumatic heart disease it is seen in young and middle aged persons. its common complication is mitral valve disease.

longDefinition: A condition of cardiac arrhythmia in which the atrial contractions are rapid i.e. 200-320 per minute but regular.
searchableText: rafrafa udhuniyya رفرفہ اذنيہ atrial flutter a condition of cardiac arrhythmia in which the atrial contractions are rapid i.e. 200-320 per minute but regular.

searchableText: sur‘a al-qalb dawriyya سرعة القلب دوريہ paroxysmal tachycardia a condition marked by attacks of rapid rate of the heart having sudden onset and cessation.

longDefinition: An abnormally rapid ventricular rhythm up to 150 per minute. This is generated within the ventricle and is most commonly associated with atrio ventricular dissociation.
searchableText: sur‘a al-qalb baṭniyya سرعة القلب بطنيہ ventricular tachycardia an abnormally rapid ventricular rhythm up to 150 per minute. this is generated within the ventricle and is most commonly associated with atrio ventricular dissociation.

longDefinition: A combination of junctional tachycardia and atrial tachycardia.
searchableText: fawq al-baṭn sur‘a al-qalb فوق البطن سرعة القلب supra ventricular tachycardia a combination of junctional tachycardia and atrial tachycardia.

longDefinition: Impairment of conduction in heart excitation often applied specifically to AV node.
searchableText: insidad al-qalb انسداد القلب heart block impairment of conduction in heart excitation often applied specifically to av node.

longDefinition: Impairment of conduction from the sino atrial node to the atrium resulting in delay or absence of an atrial beat.

longDefinition: Inadequate supply of blood to the body and its organs.

longDefinition: Sudden stoppage of the functions of heart.

term: Ḍaghṭ al-Dam Qawī Awwalī /Ḍaghṭ al-Dam Qawī Lāzimī/ Ḍaghṭ al-Dam Qawī Ibtidā’ī/ Ḍaghṭ al-Dam Qawī Dhātī/ Ḍaghṭ al-Dam Qawī Aṣlī

longDefinition: A condition where food remains in the stomach for a longer time. longDefinition: Infestation of worms in the intestines. The intestinal worms are produced as a result of putrefaction of phlegmatic fluids of the intestine. It is of four types: Ḥayyāt (roundworm), Mustadīra (hookworm), Mu‘tariḍa / Ḥabb al-Qar‘ (tape worm), Ṣighār (thread worm). Ḥayyāt (roundworm) are found in the upper part of intestine. Mustadīra (hookworm), are found in the caecum, colon. Mu‘tariḍa (tape worm) are found in the caecum. Ṣighār (thread worm) are found in rectum. General symptoms include decreased or increased appetite, tenesmus, irritation of intestine, excessive salivation, grinding of teeth during sleep, nausea after meals, restlessness, heaviness of head, irritative behaviour, delirium, headache, tinnitus, nightmares, breathlessness, epilepsy, colic, syncope, coma, etc.

longDefinition: A disease of rectum in which there is accumulation of black bile in the venules of rectum to form a polyp like growth in it. According to the shape of polyp, it is divided into seven types:1. Bawāsīr Thūlūlī: Polyps in shape of ‘Adasiya (lentil) or Ḥimmṣiya (gram). 2. Bawāsīr ‘Inabiyya: Shape of the polyps resemble grapes. 3. Bawāsīr Tūtī: The polyps resemble with the shape of mulberry. 4. Bawāsīr Naffākhī: The polyps resemble with the shape of small bubble. 5. Bawāsīr Nakhlī: Vessels of the polyps are spread like the branches and roots of date tree. 6. Bawāsīr Tīnī: Shape of the polyps are flat and round similar to that of fig. 7. Bawāsīr Tamrī: Shape of the polyps are similar to shape of date i.e. long and oval. According to presence or absence of bleeding it is divided into Bawāsīr Dāmiya (bleeding piles) and Bawāsīr ‘Umiyā / Bawāsīr Aṣam (non-bleeding piles).

longDefinition: A reduction in the size of kidneys. The condition is caused due to the hot or cold impaired temperament of kidneys. Due to the hot derangement, the fat over the kidneys gets dissolved and they become weak and their size decreases. If there is cold derangement, the kidney become weak due to the weakened digestive faculties. Sometimes it may be due to excessive sexual indulgence and intake of diuretics or purgatives. In this condition, urine becomes colourless and its quantity increases.

longDefinition: According to Unani physician this is a disease in which the expulsive faculty of kidneys becomes strong and they expel maximum water. It is a disease in which patient remains thirsty. The water taken by the patient is expelled out from the body without change or metabolism. It is due to the weakness of kidneys in which the calyces becomes dilated and are unable to hold water i.e. the retaining capacity of the kidneys is reduced. It can also be due to exposure to cold climate or increased intake of cold water. The most common cause is the increase in the innate heat of kidneys either simple, organic which increases the absorption of water from kidneys and thereby its expulsion. It is a debilitating disease in which the condition of patient deteriorates day by day. Liver becomes weak and patient gets emaciated. It is of two types: Dhayābīṭus Ḥārr (diabetes mellitus) and Dhayābīṭus Bārid (diabetes insipidus).

longDefinition: An infectious disease which transmits sexually. It is of two types: congenital and acquired. It is caused by specific causative organism. It is characterized by the presence of hard ulcer on the skin.

longDefinition: White discolouration of the skin which can appear anywhere in the body but mostly occurs on hands and feet. It is caused by the weakness of Quwwat Mughayyira (transformative faculty), cold impaired temperament of organs or it may be congenital.

longDefinition: Its literal meaning is fox’s disease. It is the falling of hair in the form of patches from scalp, beard and eyebrows. It is termed as Dā’al-Tha‘lab, because the condition of scalp resembles with the farm that has been ravaged by foxes. Its causes may be acrid phlegm, viscid and morbid sanguineous matter, consumption of spicy and salty diets, burnt blood and nervine weakness.

ḥummayat حمیات fevers

longDefinition: It is the abnormal heating of the body which after reaching the heart from any part of the body spreads to other organs through vessels. This abnormal heating interferes with the vital faculties of the body.

longDefinition: A type of fever which lasts only for few days. It is a transient and short term fever.

longDefinition: The abnormal changes occurring in the humours and body due to obnoxious substances that affect their normal functioning. Sometimes these changes occur inside the vessels i.e. Dākhil al-‘Urūq and when these changes occur outside the vessels these are known as Khārij al-‘Urūq.

longDefinition: When the putrefaction of the humours occurs inside the vessels i.e. Dākhil al-‘Urūq then the fever remains continuous.
searchableText: ḥumma da’ima/ ḥumma lazima حمیٰ دائمہ/ حمیٰ لازمہ continuous fever when the putrefaction of the humours occurs inside the vessels i.e. dākhil al-‘urūq then the fever remains continuous.

longDefinition: When the putrefaction of the humours occurs outside the vessels i.e. Khārij al-‘Urūq then it results in the fever of non-continuous nature.
searchableText: ḥumma da’ira/ ḥumma na’iba حمیٰ دائرہ/ حمیٰ نائبہ intermittent fever when the putrefaction of the humours occurs outside the vessels i.e. khārij al-‘urūq then it results in the fever of non-continuous nature.

longDefinition: A type of fever that occurs due to the predominance of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) in the body. It is of three types i.e. Ghibb Dā’ira, Ghibb Lāzima and Ghibb Muḥarriqa.
searchableText: ḥumma al-ghibb/ ṭraṭa’us حمیٰ الغب/ طراطاوس bilious fever a type of fever that occurs due to the predominance of ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) in the body. it is of three types i.e. ghibb dā’ira, ghibb lāzima and ghibb muḥarriqa.

longDefinition: When the putrefaction of yellow bile occurs outside the vessels then the attack of fever occurs after three days or approximately 48 hours. The attack usually starts with rigors and chills. It is accompanied with headache, excessive thirst, restlessness, bilious vomiting and sometimes, bilious diarrhoea. Pulse in the initial stage is irregular and later on, it becomes rapid and strong and urine is reddish and sharp smelling. This fever subsides with sweating and the attack of fever is of short duration usually 4-6 hours and sometimes it extends upto 12 hours. This type of fever has got good prognosis similar to ephemeral fever.

longDefinition: When the putrefaction of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) occurs within the vessels then the fever is continuous in nature and lasts for 5-14 days. But meanwhile there is relief in symptoms for few hours. The fever is usually high with or without rigors and chills. Before the onset of fever patient feels nausea and restlessness. In this stage the face and eyes of the patient becomes red and congested, experiences excessive thirst, bilious vomiting, pulse rapid, urine red, scanty. This fever subsides in the form of Buḥrān.

longDefinition: When the fever and its related symptom are more severe as compared to tertian fever. In this condition, the patient’s tongue becomes rough, black, fever is continuous in nature, and there is restlessness, confusion, excessive thirst and bilious vomiting. This type of fever occurs mostly in children and young people.
searchableText: ḥumma al-ghibb muḥarriqa حمیٰ الغب محرقہ high grade bilious fever when the fever and its related symptom are more severe as compared to tertian fever. in this condition, the patient’s tongue becomes rough, black, fever is continuous in nature, and there is restlessness, confusion, excessive thirst and bilious vomiting. this type of fever occurs mostly in children and young people.

longDefinition: A type of septic phlegmatic fever whose attacks occur on consecutive days. This starts with severe rigors and chills. Temperature is not very high. Pulse is low and irregular accompanied with oedematous body, phlegmatic vomiting, diarrhoea and viscous urine. It affects persons with phlegmatic temperament i.e. children and older people.
searchableText: ḥumma muwaẓiba/ astrabus حمیٰ مواظبہ/ استرابوس quotidian fever a type of septic phlegmatic fever whose attacks occur on consecutive days. this starts with severe rigors and chills. temperature is not very high. pulse is low and irregular accompanied with oedematous body, phlegmatic vomiting, diarrhoea and viscous urine. it affects persons with phlegmatic temperament i.e. children and older people.

longDefinition: The attack of septic phlegmatic fever occurs twice in a day.
searchableText: ḥumma muwaẓiba muḍa‘ifa حمیٰ مواظبہ مضاعفہ doubling quotidian fever the attack of septic phlegmatic fever occurs twice in a day.

longDefinition: When there is involvement of yellow bile in phlegm the symptoms of fever are more severe.
searchableText: ḥumma muwaẓiba ṣafrawiyya حمیٰ مواظبہ صفراويہ bilious quotidian fever when there is involvement of yellow bile in phlegm the symptoms of fever are more severe.

longDefinition: In this condition there is no rigor and chills. The symptoms are more or less same as that of Ḥummā Muwāẓiba.
searchableText: ḥumma lathiqa/ ḥumma balghamiyya lazima حمیٰ لثقہ/ حمیٰ بلغمیہ لازمہ asthenic fever in this condition there is no rigor and chills. the symptoms are more or less same as that of ḥummā muwāẓiba.

longDefinition: A type of septic melancholic fever in which subsequent attack occurs every four day. This is a type of intermittent fever because the putrefaction of black bile occurs outside the vessels. The fever occurs mostly in summer season. The fever starts with mild rigors and chills and lasts for 24 hours. It is associated with joint pain, there is involvement of spleen, hardness of pulse and excessive thirst.
searchableText: ḥumma al-rib‘/ṭaṭra حمیٰ الربع/ ططرا quartan fever a type of septic melancholic fever in which subsequent attack occurs every four day. this is a type of intermittent fever because the putrefaction of black bile occurs outside the vessels. the fever occurs mostly in summer season. the fever starts with mild rigors and chills and lasts for 24 hours. it is associated with joint pain, there is involvement of spleen, hardness of pulse and excessive thirst.

longDefinition: A type of fever that occurs when there is putrefaction of black bile inside the vessels. In this type, fever is continuous, but on the fourth day it reaches to higher degree. The attack of fever is not associated with rigors and chills. This type of fever is usually rare.
searchableText: ḥumma al-rib‘ lazima حمیٰ الربع لازمہ melancholic continuous fever a type of fever that occurs when there is putrefaction of black bile inside the vessels. in this type, fever is continuous, but on the fourth day it reaches to higher degree. the attack of fever is not associated with rigors and chills. this type of fever is usually rare.

longDefinition: A type of fever that does not follow a particular pattern. This occurs due to inflammation of organs.
searchableText: ḥumma mukhtaliṭa حمیٰ مختلطہ irregular fever a type of fever that does not follow a particular pattern. this occurs due to inflammation of organs.

longDefinition: A type of humoral fever in which the patient feels heat outside the body but cold from inside.
searchableText: ḥumma afyalus حمیٰ افيالوس ephiyalus fever a type of humoral fever in which the patient feels heat outside the body but cold from inside.

longDefinition: A type of humoral fever in which the patient feels heat inside the body but cold from outside. It is of two type; moderate and severe.
searchableText: ḥumma lifuriya حمیٰ ليفوريا liparia fever a type of humoral fever in which the patient feels heat inside the body but cold from outside. it is of two type; moderate and severe.

longDefinition: A type of Ḥummā Līfūriya, caused due to the predominance of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile).
searchableText: ṭayfudas طيفودس bilious liparia fever a type of ḥummā līfūriya, caused due to the predominance of ṣafrā’ (yellow bile).

longDefinition: A type of fever that is sanguinous in nature and rises with the passage of time. It is of two types: Muṭbiqa Ghalayāniyya and Muṭbiqa ‘Ufūniyya.
searchableText: ḥumma muṭbiqa حمیٰ مطبقہ continous fever a type of fever that is sanguinous in nature and rises with the passage of time. it is of two types: muṭbiqa ghalayāniyya and muṭbiqa ‘ufūniyya.

longDefinition: A type of fever that occurs due to the involvement of blood. The fever starts without rigors and chills. The symptoms are similar to the symptoms produced due to the predominance of blood in the body.
searchableText: ḥumma muṭbiqa ghalayaniyya/ ḥumma sunukhus حمیٰ مطبقہ غليانيہ/ حمیٰ سونوخس synochus fever/ sinoca fever a type of fever that occurs due to the involvement of blood. the fever starts without rigors and chills. the symptoms are similar to the symptoms produced due to the predominance of blood in the body.

longDefinition: A type of fever occurring due to severe putrefaction or sepsis. It is of three types: 1. Mutazā’ida, in which the symptoms gradually increases till the onset of fever, 2. Mutanāqiṣa, in which the symptoms gradually decreases till the onset of fever, 3. Mutasāwiya, in which the symptoms remain same till the onset of fever.
searchableText: ḥumma muṭbiqa‘ufuniyya حمیٰ مطبقہ عفونيہ sinoco fever a type of fever occurring due to severe putrefaction or sepsis. it is of three types: 1. mutazā’ida, in which the symptoms gradually increases till the onset of fever, 2. mutanāqiṣa, in which the symptoms gradually decreases till the onset of fever, 3. mutasāwiya, in which the symptoms remain same till the onset of fever.

longDefinition: When the attack of fever repeats after five days.
searchableText: ḥumma al-khims حمیٰ الخمس quintan fever when the attack of fever repeats after five days.

longDefinition: When the attack of fever repeats after six days.
searchableText: ḥumma al-suds حمیٰ السدس sixth day fever when the attack of fever repeats after six days.

longDefinition: When the attack of fever repeats after seven days.
searchableText: ḥumma al-sub‘ حمیٰ السبع seventh day fever when the attack of fever repeats after seven days.

longDefinition: When the attack of fever repeats after nine days.
searchableText: ḥumma al-tus‘ حمیٰ التسع ninth day fever when the attack of fever repeats after nine days.

longDefinition: A type of fever accompanied with altered sensorium because the causative humour i.e. phlegm and yellow bile affects the brain of the patient.
searchableText: ḥumma ghashiyya حمیٰ غشيہ fever with syncope a type of fever accompanied with altered sensorium because the causative humour i.e. phlegm and yellow bile affects the brain of the patient.

longDefinition: A type of continuous and infectious fever which involves intestines. It usually lasts for 21 days or more and small eruptions appear on the skin.
searchableText: ḥumma mi‘wiyya حمیٰ معويہ enteric fever a type of continuous and infectious fever which involves intestines. it usually lasts for 21 days or more and small eruptions appear on the skin.

longDefinition: A type of fever which affects the population of a particular area during a specific period. It is caused by water, air or soil pollution.
searchableText: ḥumma waba’iyya حمیٰ وبائيہ epidemic fever a type of fever which affects the population of a particular area during a specific period. it is caused by water, air or soil pollution.

longDefinition: A type of fever that is accompanied with eruptions of different colours and sizes.
searchableText: ḥumma ṭafḥiyya حمیٰ طفحيہ eruptive fever a type of fever that is accompanied with eruptions of different colours and sizes.

longDefinition: A severe infectious disease which spreads in the form of epidemic. In this condition, there is a high degree of fever and eruptions appear after three days.
searchableText: ḥumma judariyya حمیٰ جدريہ small pox a severe infectious disease which spreads in the form of epidemic. in this condition, there is a high degree of fever and eruptions appear after three days.

longDefinition: An infectious fever which is continuous in nature. This is accompanied with eruptions and infections of nasal cavity. Eruptions are scattered all over the body but are not big in size and similar to millet.
searchableText: ḥaṣba حصبہ measles an infectious fever which is continuous in nature. this is accompanied with eruptions and infections of nasal cavity. eruptions are scattered all over the body but are not big in size and similar to millet.

longDefinition: An infectious type of fever with eruptions of crimson red colour. This is usually accompanied with inflammation of throat and kidney.
searchableText: ḥumma qirmiziyya حمیٰ قرمزيہ scarlet fever an infectious type of fever with eruptions of crimson red colour. this is usually accompanied with inflammation of throat and kidney.

term: Ḥummā Ghāmiya Hadhayāniyya/Ḥummā Ruqṭa/ Ḥummā al-Sufun /Ḥummā Qadhira/Ḥummā al-Sujūn
termNormalized: ḥumma ghamiya hadhayaniyya/ḥumma ruqṭa/ ḥumma al-sufun /ḥumma qadhira/ḥumma al-sujun
nativeScript: حمیٰ غاميہ هذيانيہ /حمیٰ رقطہ /حمیٰ السفن /حمیٰ قذرہ /حمیٰ السجون
shortDefinition: Fever due to unhygienic living condition
longDefinition: A type of eruptive fever without the involvement of any organ. There is marked weakness. Sometimes there is congestion of lungs. Living in unhygienic condition, damp places and malnutrition are predisposing causes of this fever. This fever is accompanied with delirium and coma.
searchableText: ḥumma ghamiya hadhayaniyya/ḥumma ruqṭa/ ḥumma al-sufun /ḥumma qadhira/ḥumma al-sujun حمیٰ غاميہ هذيانيہ /حمیٰ رقطہ /حمیٰ السفن /حمیٰ قذرہ /حمیٰ السجون fever due to unhygienic living condition a type of eruptive fever without the involvement of any organ. there is marked weakness. sometimes there is congestion of lungs. living in unhygienic condition, damp places and malnutrition are predisposing causes of this fever. this fever is accompanied with delirium and coma.

longDefinition: A type of eruptive fever in which the symptoms are not severe. The eruptions are colourless, bigger in size. Fever is usually not high. There is no marked weakness. It is not accompanied with delirium and coma.
searchableText: ḥumayqa/ bad abla حميقہ/ بادآبلہ chicken pox a type of eruptive fever in which the symptoms are not severe. the eruptions are colourless, bigger in size. fever is usually not high. there is no marked weakness. it is not accompanied with delirium and coma.

shortDefinition: Fever due to sweet and saline or vitreous or sour phlegm
longDefinition: A type of fever caused by Balgham Zujājī (vitreous phlegm) and Balgham Shor (saline phlegm). This fever does not last for a long time.
searchableText: ḥumma zamhaririyya/ fardmuriyus حمیٰ زمهريريہ/ فردموريوس fever due to sweet and saline or vitreous or sour phlegm a type of fever caused by balgham zujājī (vitreous phlegm) and balgham shor (saline phlegm). this fever does not last for a long time.

longDefinition: A type of melancholic fever which occurs after five, six, seven, eight or nine days.
searchableText: fimaṭus/ dawwara فيماطوس/ دوارہ intermittent fever a type of melancholic fever which occurs after five, six, seven, eight or nine days.

shortDefinition: Bleeding under skin due to fever
longDefinition: Haemorrhages occurring beneath the skin, petechial or bigger in size and caused by fevers e.g. Ḥummā Ghāmiyya, etc.
searchableText: qatma قتمہ bleeding under skin due to fever haemorrhages occurring beneath the skin, petechial or bigger in size and caused by fevers e.g. ḥummā ghāmiyya, etc.

longDefinition: A type of infectious fever caused by the organism found in the stagnant water. This is characterised by enlargement of spleen.
searchableText: ḥumma ajamiyya حمیٰ اجاميہ marshy area fever a type of infectious fever caused by the organism found in the stagnant water. this is characterised by enlargement of spleen.
amrad-i-‘iẓam wa mafaṣil امراض عظام و مفاصل diseases of bones and joints

longDefinition: Pain of the back can be superficial or deep. It can be due to cold impaired temperament, predominance of phlegm, physical exertion, incorrect sitting posture, increased sexual activity, weakness of kidneys, premenstrual pain, labour pain, congestion of portal vein and aorta.
searchableText: waja‘ al-ẓahr وجع الظهر backache pain of the back can be superficial or deep. it can be due to cold impaired temperament, predominance of phlegm, physical exertion, incorrect sitting posture, increased sexual activity, weakness of kidneys, premenstrual pain, labour pain, congestion of portal vein and aorta.

longDefinition: Pain of the lower portion of back.
searchableText: waja‘ al-khaṣira وجع الخاصرة lowbackache pain of the lower portion of back.

longDefinition: Inflammation and pain of joints with redness of the skin. Sometimes it involves heart.
searchableText: ḥudar حدار rheumatism inflammation and pain of joints with redness of the skin. sometimes it involves heart.

longDefinition: A type of arthalgia which involves several joints. As per involvement of humours it is of four types i.e. Damawī, Balghamī, Ṣafrāwī and Sawdāwī. According to severity of symptoms it is again divided into acute and chronic type. When two humours are involved this is known as Waja‘ al-Mafāṣil Murakkab.
searchableText: waja‘ al-mafaṣil وجع المفاصل polyarthritis a type of arthalgia which involves several joints. as per involvement of humours it is of four types i.e. damawī, balghamī, ṣafrāwī and sawdāwī. according to severity of symptoms it is again divided into acute and chronic type. when two humours are involved this is known as waja‘ al-mafāṣil murakkab.

longDefinition: Pain of hip joint. Its causes are same as Waja‘ al-Mafāṣil.
searchableText: waja‘ al-warik وجع الورك coccydynia pain of hip joint. its causes are same as waja‘ al-mafāṣil.

longDefinition: Severe pain in the heel which is also known as Nuzūl al-Mā’ i.e. infiltration of water. It is caused by the infiltration of acrid humours after pain.
searchableText: waja‘ al-‘aqib وجع العقب achillodynia severe pain in the heel which is also known as nuzūl al-mā’ i.e. infiltration of water. it is caused by the infiltration of acrid humours after pain.

longDefinition: A specific type of swelling and pain that occurs in foot specially great toe. But sometimes it may affect wrist and fingers of hand also. According to Ibn Hubal, toe joints are known as Inqūrūs from which the word Niqris been derived. It is a heredity disease.
searchableText: niqris نقرس gout a specific type of swelling and pain that occurs in foot specially great toe. but sometimes it may affect wrist and fingers of hand also. according to ibn hubal, toe joints are known as inqūrūs from which the word niqris been derived. it is a heredity disease.

longDefinition: A type of pain which originates from the hip joints and runs along with the sciatic nerve. Intensity of pain increases with the quantity of matter.This pain causes wasting of the muscles of legs due to disuse.
searchableText: ‘irq al-nasa عرق النسا sciatica a type of pain which originates from the hip joints and runs along with the sciatic nerve. intensity of pain increases with the quantity of matter.this pain causes wasting of the muscles of legs due to disuse.

longDefinition: The ossification of joints and reduced joint spaces leading to locking of the joints.
searchableText: taḥajjur wa ṣalaba al-mafaṣil تحجر وصلابة المفاصل ankylosing arthritis the ossification of joints and reduced joint spaces leading to locking of the joints.

longDefinition: A deformity in which there is backward bending of the vertebral column.
searchableText: ḥadaba/ ḥadaba al-mu’akhkhar حدبہ/ حدبة الموخر kyphosis a deformity in which there is backward bending of the vertebral column.

longDefinition: Forward bending of chest.
searchableText: taqaṣṣu‘/ḥadaba al-muqaddam تقصع/ حدبة المقدم lordosis forward bending of chest.

longDefinition: Dislocation of vertebral column at one side.
searchableText: iltiwa’ التواء scoliosis dislocation of vertebral column at one side.

longDefinition: Displacement of vertebral column commonly seen in tubercular patients. In this a chronic ulcer damages the vertebral column up to the gangrenous stage. Due to this destruction, there is displacement of vertebral column.
searchableText: riyaḥ al-afrisa رياح الافرسة pott's disease/koch's spine displacement of vertebral column commonly seen in tubercular patients. in this a chronic ulcer damages the vertebral column up to the gangrenous stage. due to this destruction, there is displacement of vertebral column.

term: Wahn al-‘Iẓām/ Takhalkhul al-‘Iẓām/ Takhaththur al-‘Iẓām
termNormalized: wahn al-‘iẓam/ takhalkhul al-‘iẓam/ takhaththur al-‘iẓam
nativeScript: وهن العظام/ تخلخل العظام/ تخثر العظام
longDefinition: It means weakness of bones in old age or pain of bones after trauma and injury. Bones are more prone to fractures in this condition.
searchableText: wahn al-‘iẓam/ takhalkhul al-‘iẓam/ takhaththur al-‘iẓam وهن العظام/ تخلخل العظام/ تخثر العظام osteoporosis it means weakness of bones in old age or pain of bones after trauma and injury. bones are more prone to fractures in this condition.

longDefinition: Discontinuity/breaking of bones.
searchableText: kasr كسر fracture discontinuity/breaking of bones.

longDefinition: In this condition, only the bone is broken and there is no discontinuity of skin and mucous membrane.
searchableText: kasr basiṭ/ kasr sadhij كسر بسيط/ كسر ساذج simple facture in this condition, only the bone is broken and there is no discontinuity of skin and mucous membrane.

longDefinition: Breakage of bone associated with skin and mucous membrane. There is laceration of skin by the fragments of broken bone.
searchableText: kasr murakkab/ kasr makshuf كسر مركب/ كسر مكشوف compound fracture breakage of bone associated with skin and mucous membrane. there is laceration of skin by the fragments of broken bone.

longDefinition: Breakage or discontinuity of bone along with the involvement of surrounding organs either artery or vein. It is either due to trauma from outside or puncture by the fragments of broken bones.
searchableText: kasr muḍa‘af/ kasr mukhtaliṭ كسر مضاعف/ كسر مختلط complicated fracture breakage or discontinuity of bone along with the involvement of surrounding organs either artery or vein. it is either due to trauma from outside or puncture by the fragments of broken bones.

longDefinition: Complete breakage or discontinuity of the bone.
searchableText: kasr kamil كسر كامل complete fracture complete breakage or discontinuity of the bone.

term: Kasr Ghayr Kāmil/ Kasr Juz’ī Kāmil
termNormalized: kasr ghayr kamil/ kasr juz’i kamil
longDefinition: Incomplete breaking or discontinuity of the bone.
searchableText: kasr ghayr kamil/ kasr juz’i kamil كسر غير كامل/ كسرجزئي كامل incomplete fracture incomplete breaking or discontinuity of the bone.

longDefinition: The fracture of bone longitudinally. It occurs mostly in flat bones e.g. skull, scapula, etc. It is usually too small to trace.
searchableText: kasr ṣad‘i كسر صدعى longitudinal fracture the fracture of bone longitudinally. it occurs mostly in flat bones e.g. skull, scapula, etc. it is usually too small to trace.

longDefinition: An incomplete type of fracture which occurs mostly in children or ribs of older people. It resembles the breaking of fresh green branch of tree which when bended gets partially broken with some of its fibres remaining intact.
searchableText: kasr kharrubi كسر خروبي green stick fracture an incomplete type of fracture which occurs mostly in children or ribs of older people. it resembles the breaking of fresh green branch of tree which when bended gets partially broken with some of its fibres remaining intact.

longDefinition: Crushing of a single bone into many pieces.
searchableText: kasr mufattat كسر مفتت comminuted fracture crushing of a single bone into many pieces.

longDefinition: Breaking of bone with injury by some sharp objects and exposure of a piece of bone outside.
searchableText: kasr shaṭwi كسر شطوى avulsion fracture breaking of bone with injury by some sharp objects and exposure of a piece of bone outside.

longDefinition: A perforating type of breakage of bone.
searchableText: kasr thaqib كسر ثاقب perforating fracture a perforating type of breakage of bone.

longDefinition: In this type of fracture, breaking occurs longitudinally or in the length of bone.
searchableText: kasr mustaṭil/ kasr mushaṭṭab كسر مستطيل/ كسر مشطب longitudinal fracture in this type of fracture, breaking occurs longitudinally or in the length of bone.

longDefinition: In this type of fracture, breaking of bone occurs transversally.
searchableText: kasr musta‘raḍ/ kasr muta‘addid كسر مستعرض/ كسر متعدد transverse fracture in this type of fracture, breaking of bone occurs transversally.

longDefinition: In this type of fracture breaking of bone occurs obliquely.
searchableText: kasr mu’arrab كسر مؤرب oblique fracture in this type of fracture breaking of bone occurs obliquely.

longDefinition: In this type of fracture, breaking of bone occurs in twisted manner or spiral manner.
searchableText: kasr lawlabi/ kasr ḥalazuni كسر لولبي/ كسر حلزوني spiral fracture in this type of fracture, breaking of bone occurs in twisted manner or spiral manner.

longDefinition: A type of fracture in which broken long bones penetrate into the soft tissue.
searchableText: kasr mudgham/ kasr munghariz كسر مدغم/ كسر منغرز impacted fracture a type of fracture in which broken long bones penetrate into the soft tissue.

longDefinition: The fracture of bones of foetus inside the uterus due to the trauma to the abdomen of expecting women.
searchableText: kasr raḥimi كسر رحمى intrauterine fracture the fracture of bones of foetus inside the uterus due to the trauma to the abdomen of expecting women.

longDefinition: Fracture of the bones of a new born due to bad obstetric procedure.
searchableText: kasr khilqi كسر خلقي congenital fracture fracture of the bones of a new born due to bad obstetric procedure.

longDefinition: In this type, there is a thinline fracture of bones.
searchableText: kasr sha‘ri كسر شعري hairline fracture in this type, there is a thinline fracture of bones.

longDefinition: A fracture that occurs in the bones due to some disease.
searchableText: kasr dhati كسر ذاتي pathological fracture a fracture that occurs in the bones due to some disease.

longDefinition: Fracture of the edges of bones.
searchableText: kasr mafṣili كسر مفصلي epiphyseal fracture fracture of the edges of bones.

longDefinition: Fracture of nasal bone.
searchableText: kasr al-anf كسر الانف nasal bone fracture fracture of nasal bone.

nativeScript: كسر فجلي/ كسر قصبي/ كسر قثوى
longDefinition: Deep and broad fracture of the bones.
searchableText: kasr fujli/kasr qaṣabi/ kasr qathwi كسر فجلي/ كسر قصبي/ كسر قثوى deep and broad fracture deep and broad fracture of the bones.

longDefinition: Broad and long fracture of bones.
searchableText: kasr hilali كسر هلالي crescent fracture broad and long fracture of bones.

term: Kasr Sawīqī/ Kasr Qaḍībī/ Kasr Jawzī/ Kasr Jarīshī
termNormalized: kasr sawiqi/ kasr qaḍibi/ kasr jawzi/ kasr jarishi
nativeScript: كسر سويقي/ كسر قضيبي/ كسر جوزي/ كسر جريشي
longDefinition: Crushed fracture of the bones.
searchableText: kasr sawiqi/ kasr qaḍibi/ kasr jawzi/ kasr jarishi كسر سويقي/ كسر قضيبي/ كسر جوزي/ كسر جريشي crushed fracture crushed fracture of the bones.

longDefinition: It is the slipping out of a bone from joint.
searchableText: khal‘ خلع dislocation of joint it is the slipping out of a bone from joint.

longDefinition: Dislocation of joints caused by two factors i.e. exogenous and endogenous. Exogenous factors, include trauma of the joint. Endogenous factors include the weakness of joint, ligaments etc.
searchableText: khal‘ ḍarbi خلع ضربي traumatic dislocation dislocation of joints caused by two factors i.e. exogenous and endogenous. exogenous factors, include trauma of the joint. endogenous factors include the weakness of joint, ligaments etc.

longDefinition: Total deviation or displacement of bone from its adjoining bone.
searchableText: khal‘ al-mafaṣil خلع المفاصل dislocation of joints total deviation or displacement of bone from its adjoining bone.

longDefinition: A type of dislocation which is present at birth. It is caused either by the abnormal position of the foetus in the uterus or by defect in the process of formation of structure in foetal life. The most common congenital dislocation is the dislocation of hip joint.
searchableText: khal‘ khilqi خلع خلقي congenital dislocation a type of dislocation which is present at birth. it is caused either by the abnormal position of the foetus in the uterus or by defect in the process of formation of structure in foetal life. the most common congenital dislocation is the dislocation of hip joint.

longDefinition: A type of dislocation occurring due to joint diseases e.g. inflammation, pus formation or tubercular infection and other nerve disorders
searchableText: khal‘ maraḍi/ khal‘ ‘arḍi خلع مرضى/ خلع عرضي pathologic dislocation a type of dislocation occurring due to joint diseases e.g. inflammation, pus formation or tubercular infection and other nerve disorders

longDefinition: When the head of the bone completely subluxates from its normal position
searchableText: khal‘ tamm/ khal‘ kamil خلع تام/ خلع كامل complete dislocation when the head of the bone completely subluxates from its normal position

term: Khal‘ Ghayr Tāmm/ Khal‘ Ghayr Kāmil/ Khal‘ Ghayr Mukammal
termNormalized: khal‘ ghayr tamm/ khal‘ ghayr kamil/ khal‘ ghayr mukammal
nativeScript: خلع غير تام/ خلع غير كامل/ خلع غير مكمل
longDefinition: When the head of the bone partially subluxates from its normal position.
searchableText: khal‘ ghayr tamm/ khal‘ ghayr kamil/ khal‘ ghayr mukammal خلع غير تام/ خلع غير كامل/ خلع غير مكمل incomplete dislocation when the head of the bone partially subluxates from its normal position.

longDefinition: When there is injury of the skin with dislocation.
searchableText: khal‘ murakkab خلع مركب compound dislocation when there is injury of the skin with dislocation.

longDefinition: When there is injury of vessels and bones with dislocation. This is a complicated type of dislocation.
searchableText: khal‘ muḍa‘af خلع مضاعف complicated dislocation when there is injury of vessels and bones with dislocation. this is a complicated type of dislocation.

longDefinition: When there is fracture with dislocation of bone.
searchableText: khal‘ kasri خلع كسرى fracture dislocation when there is fracture with dislocation of bone.

longDefinition: Partial displacement of the bone from its joint.
searchableText: watha وثیٰ spraining partial displacement of the bone from its joint.
jaraḥat جراحت surgery

longDefinition: Breaches in the continuity of muscles and other tissues of the body.
searchableText: juruḥ جروح wounds breaches in the continuity of muscles and other tissues of the body.

longDefinition: Discontinuity of skin and mucous membrane which is exposed outside.
searchableText: juruḥ maftuḥa/ juruḥ waḍiḥa جروح مفتوحہ/ جروح واضحہ open wounds discontinuity of skin and mucous membrane which is exposed outside.

longDefinition: Wounds which are produced by sharp instruments or objects.
searchableText: juruḥ qaṭ‘iyya جروح قطعيہ incised wounds wounds which are produced by sharp instruments or objects.

longDefinition: Wounds caused by pointed sharp objects that involve skin and underlying tissues.
searchableText: juruḥ wakhiziyya جروح وخزيہ penetrating wounds wounds caused by pointed sharp objects that involve skin and underlying tissues.

longDefinition: Wounds with irregular and jagged edges and characterised by the massive destruction of tissues.
searchableText: juruḥ mazqiyya جروح مزقيہ lacerated wounds wounds with irregular and jagged edges and characterised by the massive destruction of tissues.

longDefinition: Wounds having six edges.
searchableText: juruḥ musaddasa/ juruḥ shashkhana جروح مسدسہ / جروح شش خانہ wounds having six edges wounds having six edges.

longDefinition: Closed blunt wounds not involving skin.
searchableText: juruḥ raḍḍiyya جروح رضيہ contused wounds closed blunt wounds not involving skin.

longDefinition: Wounds caused by the bite of poisonous animals.
searchableText: juruḥ sammiyya جروح سميہ poisoned wounds wounds caused by the bite of poisonous animals.

longDefinition: Wounds caused by burn.
searchableText: juruḥ nariyya/ juruḥ barudiyya جروح ناريہ/ جروح باروديہ burnt or gunshot wounds wounds caused by burn.

longDefinition: Wounds that are infected and suppurated.
searchableText: juruḥ ‘ufuniyya جروح عفونيہ suppurated wounds wounds that are infected and suppurated.

longDefinition: Wounds that are not infected and not suppurated.
searchableText: juruḥ ghayr ‘ufuniyya/ juruḥ ghayr mulawwatha جروح غير عفونيہ /جروح غير ملوثہ non-suppurated wounds wounds that are not infected and not suppurated.

longDefinition: A systemic disease associated with the presence, multiplication and formation of septic emboli in the blood.
searchableText: ta‘affun al-dam تعفن الدم septicaemia a systemic disease associated with the presence, multiplication and formation of septic emboli in the blood.

longDefinition: A condition which results from the spread of bacterial products or toxins in the blood stream.
searchableText: tasammum al-dam تسمم الدم toxaemia a condition which results from the spread of bacterial products or toxins in the blood stream.

longDefinition: Presence of pus in the blood with pyemic abscesses. This condition is marked by fevers, chills, sweating and abscess in various parts of the body.
searchableText: taqayyuḥ al-dam تقيح الدم pyemia presence of pus in the blood with pyemic abscesses. this condition is marked by fevers, chills, sweating and abscess in various parts of the body.

longDefinition: Breach in the continuity of the epithelial membrane is known as ulcer. It is caused by some injury, abscess and skin eruptions.
searchableText: qarḥa قرحہ ulcer breach in the continuity of the epithelial membrane is known as ulcer. it is caused by some injury, abscess and skin eruptions.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer caused by pus forming bacteria.
searchableText: qarḥa ‘arḍiyya قرحہ عرضيہ secondary ulcer a type of ulcer caused by pus forming bacteria.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer caused by specific causative organism e.g. syphilitic ulcers, tuberculous ulcers, etc.
searchableText: qarḥa naw‘iyya قرحہ نوعيہ specific infectious ulcer a type of ulcer caused by specific causative organism e.g. syphilitic ulcers, tuberculous ulcers, etc.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer that doesn’t heal easily or the healing is delayed.
searchableText: qarḥa khabitha/ qarḥa ‘afina قرحہ خبيثہ/ قرحہ عفنہ lupoid ulcer/malignant ulcer a type of ulcer that doesn’t heal easily or the healing is delayed.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer accompanied with pain.
searchableText: qarḥa mulima قرحہ مولمہ painful ulcer a type of ulcer accompanied with pain.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer not accompanied with pain.
searchableText: qarḥa ghayr mulima قرحہ غيرمولمہ painless ulcer a type of ulcer not accompanied with pain.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer that is easily healed.
searchableText: qarḥa salima قرحہ سليمہ benign ulcer a type of ulcer that is easily healed.

longDefinition: A type of ulcer that is difficult to heal e.g. varicose ulcer.
searchableText: qarḥa ‘asir al-indimal قرحة عسر الاندمال indolent ulcer/callous ulcer a type of ulcer that is difficult to heal e.g. varicose ulcer.

longDefinition: A grave kind of ulcer, named after the person Khayrūn who first suffered from this.

longDefinition: The word Ṭā‘ūn is an altered form of the Unani word Ṭay‘ūn meaning inflammation of lymph glands of the body. longDefinition: A condition of  pain of several joints  due to the derangement of phlegm. It is characterised by white coloured swelling on the affected joint, moderate  and deep seated pain of the joint. It is usually seen in obese patients.
searchableText: waja‘ al-mafaṣil balghami وجع المفاصل بلغمی phlegmatic arthritis a condition of  pain of several joints  due to the derangement of phlegm. it is characterised by white coloured swelling on the affected joint, moderate  and deep seated pain of the joint. it is usually seen in obese patients.

longDefinition: A condition of  pain of several joints  due to the derangement of black bile. It is characterised by blackish discoloration of skin, less pain,  dryness and tension at the site of swelling.
searchableText: waja‘ al-mafaṣil sawdawi وجع المفاصل سوداوی melancholic arthritis a condition of  pain of several joints  due to the derangement of black bile. it is characterised by blackish discoloration of skin, less pain,  dryness and tension at the site of swelling.

longDefinition: A condition of  pain of several joints  due to accumulation of  more than one deranged humours.

longDefinition: It is a condition of appearance of red itchy rashes suddenly due to sanguineous predominance. It is characterized by appearance of red itchy rashes during day time.

longDefinition: It is a condition of appearance of red itchy rashes suddenly due to phlegmatic predominance. It is characterized by appearance of white coloured itchy rashes during night time.
searchableText: shara balghami شریٰ بلغمی phlegmatic urticaria it is a condition of appearance of red itchy rashes suddenly due to phlegmatic predominance. it is characterized by appearance of white coloured itchy rashes during night time.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of yellow bile. It is characterized by pointed papules of red colour accompanied by severe pain and itching.
searchableText: jarab ṣafrawi جرب   صفراوی bilious scabies a condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of yellow bile. it is characterized by pointed papules of red colour accompanied by severe pain and itching.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of black bile. It is characterized by papules having roots of black colour accompanied by less pain and itching. This condition is usually chronic in nature and takes a lot of time to cure.
searchableText: jarab sawdawi جرب    سوداوی melancholic scabies a condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of black bile. it is characterized by papules having roots of black colour accompanied by less pain and itching. this condition is usually chronic in nature and takes a lot of time to cure.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of phlegm. It is characterized by flat papules that are spreaded and contains pus.
searchableText: jarab balghami جرب  بلغمی phlegmatic scabies a condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of phlegm. it is characterized by flat papules that are spreaded and contains pus.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of wetness. It is characterized by papules from which fluids, pus and sometimes blackish blood ooze out. This condition is marked by severe itching and burning of the affected part.
searchableText: jarab ratab جرب  رطب wet scabies a condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of wetness. it is characterized by papules from which fluids, pus and sometimes blackish blood ooze out. this condition is marked by severe itching and burning of the affected part.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of dryness. It is characterized by papules with scab formation.
searchableText: jarab yabis جرب  یابس dry scabies a condition of appearance of papules caused by the predominance of dryness. it is characterized by papules with scab formation.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of hard eruptions with pointed tip and may produce pain when touched.  The edges of these eruptions are circular.
searchableText: masamir مسامیر a type of wart a condition of appearance of hard eruptions with pointed tip and may produce pain when touched.  the edges of these eruptions are circular.

longDefinition: A condition of appearance of hard eruptions with slanting edges and resembles the shape of horn of animals.
searchableText: qurun قرون cutaneous horn a condition of appearance of hard eruptions with slanting edges and resembles the shape of horn of animals.

longDefinition: A condition caused by cold morbid temperament of kidneys. The condition is characterised by increased thirst, whitish discoloration of face, clourless urine, renal area cold on touch, decreased libido, gradual weight loss, etc.
searchableText: dhayabiṭus barid ذيابيطس بارد diabetes insipidus a condition caused by cold morbid temperament of kidneys. the condition is characterised by increased thirst, whitish discoloration of face, clourless urine, renal area cold on touch, decreased libido, gradual weight loss, etc.

longDefinition: A condition of inflammation of bladder due to predominance of sanguine. This condition is characterised by high grade fever,severe pain, pelvic irritation and heaviness, redness of eyes and face, difficulty in micturition and rapid pulse.
searchableText: waram-i-mathana damawi ورم مثانہ دموی sanguineous cystitis a condition of inflammation of bladder due to predominance of sanguine. this condition is characterised by high grade fever,severe pain, pelvic irritation and heaviness, redness of eyes and face, difficulty in micturition and rapid pulse.

longDefinition: A condition of inflammation of bladder due to predominance of yellow bile. This condition is characterised by high grade fever, excessive thirst, severe pain with burning sensation, bilious vomiting and difficulty in micturition.
searchableText: waram-i-mathana shafrawi ورم مثانہ صفراوی bilious cystitis a condition of inflammation of bladder due to predominance of yellow bile. this condition is characterised by high grade fever, excessive thirst, severe pain with burning sensation, bilious vomiting and difficulty in micturition.

longDefinition: A condition of inflammation of bladder due to predominance of phlegm. This condit ion is characterised by heaviness in pelvic region and difficulty in micturition.
searchableText: waram-i-mathana balghami ورم مثانہ بلغمی phlegmatic cystitis a condition of inflammation of bladder due to predominance of phlegm. this condit ion is characterised by heaviness in pelvic region and difficulty in micturition.

longDefinition: Chronic inflammation of testes caused by predominance of black bile and characterised by presence of blackish hard swelling without pain.

longDefinition: Inflammation of testes due to accumulation of gases. This condition is characterised by whitish swelling and pain without heaviness.
searchableText: waram al-khuṣyatayn rihi/waram al-unthayayn rihi ورم الخصيتين ریحی/ورم الانثيين ریحی gaseous orchitis inflammation of testes due to accumulation of gases. this condition is characterised by whitish swelling and pain without heaviness.

longDefinition: A condition of collection of fluid in tunica vaginalis.
searchableText: qila ma’iyya ghimdi قيلہ مائيہ غمدی scrotal hydrocele a condition of collection of fluid in tunica vaginalis.

longDefinition: A condition of collection of fluid in cavities of inguinal canal which shifts to abdominal cavity on putting pressure and reverts back when the pressure is released.
searchableText: qila ma’iyya khilqi قيلہ مائيہ خلقی congenital hydrocele a condition of collection of fluid in cavities of inguinal canal which shifts to abdominal cavity on putting pressure and reverts back when the pressure is released.

longDefinition: A condition of collection of fluid in a separate sac instead of whole covering.
searchableText: qila ma’iyya kisi قيلہ مائيہ کیسی encysted hydrocele a condition of collection of fluid in a separate sac instead of whole covering.

longDefinition: A condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of heat. This condition is characterised by discharge of decreased quantity of reddish or foul-smelling blackish menstrual blood of thick consistency, palpitation, restlessness, dry lips and swift pulse.
searchableText: su’-i-mizaj al-raḥim al-harr سوء مزاج الرحم الحار hot morbid temperament of uterus a condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of heat. this condition is characterised by discharge of decreased quantity of reddish or foul-smelling blackish menstrual blood of thick consistency, palpitation, restlessness, dry lips and swift pulse.

longDefinition: A condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of cold. This condition is characterised by absence of menstruation or discharge of decreased quantity of light red menstrual blood of thin consistency, pale skin and slow pulse.
searchableText: su’-i-mizaj al-raḥim al-barid سوء مزاج الرحم البارد cold morbid temperament of uterus a condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of cold. this condition is characterised by absence of menstruation or discharge of decreased quantity of light red menstrual blood of thin consistency, pale skin and slow pulse.

longDefinition: A condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of moistness. This condition is characterised by discharge of excessive menstual blood of thin consistency, excessive discharge of secretions from uterus and abortion within the three months of conception.
searchableText: su’-i-mizaj al-raḥim al-raṭb سوء مزاج الرحم الرطب moist morbid temperament of uterus a condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of moistness. this condition is characterised by discharge of excessive menstual blood of thin consistency, excessive discharge of secretions from uterus and abortion within the three months of conception.

longDefinition: A condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of dryness. This condition is characterised by discharge of decresed quantity of menstrual blood, dryness of cervix and thin body.
searchableText: su’-i-mizaj al-raḥim al-yabis سوء مزاج الرحم الیابس dry morbid temperament of uterus a condition of derangement in the temperament of uterus due to predominance of dryness. this condition is characterised by discharge of decresed quantity of menstrual blood, dryness of cervix and thin body.

longDefinition: A condition of reduction in the ovarian size caused by factors arising during the antenatal period. This condition is characterised by primary amenorrhoea.
searchableText: taṣaghghur khuṣya al-raḥim khilqi تصغر خصية الرحم خلقی congenital atrophy of ovaries a condition of reduction in the ovarian size caused by factors arising during the antenatal period. this condition is characterised by primary amenorrhoea.

longDefinition: A condition of reduction in the ovarian size  caused by factors arising during after birth. Its is characterized by irregular menstruation leading to amenorrhoea.
searchableText: taṣaghghur khuṣya al-raḥim iktisabi تصغر خصية الرحم اکتسابی acquired atrophy of ovaries a condition of reduction in the ovarian size  caused by factors arising during after birth. its is characterized by irregular menstruation leading to amenorrhoea.

longDefinition: Acute inflammation of fallopian tubes which usually extends up to the ovaries. It is caused by puerperal infection, syphylis, gonorrhoea, etc. and characterised by severe pain in pelvis and back aggravating during movement, high grade fever, swift pulse, etc.
searchableText: iltihab al-qadhif hadd التهاب القاذف حاد acute salpingitis acute inflammation of fallopian tubes which usually extends up to the ovaries. it is caused by puerperal infection, syphylis, gonorrhoea, etc. and characterised by severe pain in pelvis and back aggravating during movement, high grade fever, swift pulse, etc.

longDefinition: Inflammation of fallopian tubes which usually extends up to the ovaries. It is characterised by dull pain in pelvis, backache, irregular menses, etc.
searchableText: iltihab al-qadhif muzmin التهاب القاذف مزمن chronic salpingitis inflammation of fallopian tubes which usually extends up to the ovaries. it is characterised by dull pain in pelvis, backache, irregular menses, etc.

longDefinition: It is the inflammation of breast caused by predominance of sanguine, coagulation of blood and milk within the breast and trauma. It is characterised by swollen breast, pain, redness, fever, etc.
searchableText: waram-i-thadi harr ورم ثدي حار acute mastitis it is the inflammation of breast caused by predominance of sanguine, coagulation of blood and milk within the breast and trauma. it is characterised by swollen breast, pain, redness, fever, etc.

longDefinition: It is the chronic inflammation of breast characterised by lesser degree of pain as compared to its acute type and absence of redness and fever.
searchableText: waram-i-thadi barid ورم ثدی بارد chronic mastitis it is the chronic inflammation of breast characterised by lesser degree of pain as compared to its acute type and absence of redness and fever.

longDefinition: It is the chronic inflammation of breast caused by predominance of black bile characterised by hardeness and slight blackish discolouration of breast.
searchableText: waram-i-thadi ṣulb ورم ثدی صلب hard mastitis it is the chronic inflammation of breast caused by predominance of black bile characterised by hardeness and slight blackish discolouration of breast.

longDefinition: A condition of inflammation of uterus affecting its different parts due to pouring of sanguineous or bilious matter on uterus. This condition is characterised by high grade fever, pain in pubic region, backache, pulsating pain in anterior fontanelle, excessive thirst, bitter taste, rapid respiration and swift rapid pulse.
searchableText: waram-i-raḥim ḥarr ورم رحم حار acute metritis a condition of inflammation of uterus affecting its different parts due to pouring of sanguineous or bilious matter on uterus. this condition is characterised by high grade fever, pain in pubic region, backache, pulsating pain in anterior fontanelle, excessive thirst, bitter taste, rapid respiration and swift rapid pulse.

longDefinition: A condition of inflammation of uterus affecting its different parts due to predominance of phlegm. This condition is characterised by low grade fever, dull pain and heaviness at the site of uterus and puffiness on face, hand and leg.
searchableText: waram-i-raḥim balghami ورم رحم بلغمی phlegmatic metritis a condition of inflammation of uterus affecting its different parts due to predominance of phlegm. this condition is characterised by low grade fever, dull pain and heaviness at the site of uterus and puffiness on face, hand and leg.

longDefinition: A condition of inflammation of uterus affecting its different parts due to predominance of black bile. This condition is characterised by low intensity pain accompanied with hardness and heaviness in suprapubic region, difficulty in urination and defaecation and general weakness.
searchableText: waram-i-raḥim ṣulb ورم رحم صلب hard metritis a condition of inflammation of uterus affecting its different parts due to predominance of black bile. this condition is characterised by low intensity pain accompanied with hardness and heaviness in suprapubic region, difficulty in urination and defaecation and general weakness.

longDefinition: A condition of formation and collection of purulent matter inside the uterus. This condition is characterized by throbbing pain, fever and tenderness in the lower abdomen.
searchableText: dubayla al-raḥim دبيلة الرحم uterine abscess a condition of formation and collection of purulent matter inside the uterus. this condition is characterized by throbbing pain, fever and tenderness in the lower abdomen.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of pure yellow bile, outside the vessels. This condition is characterised by seven episodes of high grade fever lasting for 4-12 hours.
searchableText: ghibb khalisha غب خالصہ pure tertian fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of pure yellow bile, outside the vessels. this condition is characterised by seven episodes of high grade fever lasting for 4-12 hours.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of yellow bile mixed with phlegm, outside the vessels. This condition is characterised by episodes of fever lasting for more than 12 hours, severe heaviness in the head.
searchableText: ghibb ghayr khalisha غب غیر خالصہ false tertian fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of yellow bile mixed with phlegm, outside the vessels. this condition is characterised by episodes of fever lasting for more than 12 hours, severe heaviness in the head.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of normal or abnormal black bile outside the vessels. This condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day along with the history of previous fever of long duration, diseases of spleen, intake of black bile producing diets, etc.
searchableText: ḥumma al-rib‘ da’ira حمیٰ الربع دائرہ intermittent quartan fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of normal or abnormal black bile outside the vessels. this condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day along with the history of previous fever of long duration, diseases of spleen, intake of black bile producing diets, etc.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature occurring after sanguineous fever as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of sanguine. This condition is initially characterised by features of sanguineous fever followed by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, reddish skin colour, heavniess in the body, sweet taste in mouth and reddish urine.
searchableText: rib‘ damawi ربع دموی sanguineous quartan fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature occurring after sanguineous fever as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of sanguine. this condition is initially characterised by features of sanguineous fever followed by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, reddish skin colour, heavniess in the body, sweet taste in mouth and reddish urine.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature occurring after bilious fever as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of yellow bile. This condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, rigors and chills, biiter taste in mouth, excessive thirst and perspiration and swift and rapid pulse.
searchableText: rib‘ shafrawi ربع صفراوی bilious quartan fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature occurring after bilious fever as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of yellow bile. this condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, rigors and chills, biiter taste in mouth, excessive thirst and perspiration and swift and rapid pulse.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature occurring after phlegmatic fever as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of phlegm. This condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, decreased thirst, laziness, delayed perspiration, large sluggish pulse and urine of thick consistency.
searchableText: rib‘ balghami ربع بلغمی phlegmatic quartan fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature occurring after phlegmatic fever as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of phlegm. this condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, decreased thirst, laziness, delayed perspiration, large sluggish pulse and urine of thick consistency.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of normal black bile. This condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, abnormal thoughts, suspicion and nightmares.
searchableText: rib‘ sawdawi ربع سوداوی melancholic quartan fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of putrefaction of abnormal black bile produced due to combustion of normal black bile. this condition is characterised by intermittent fever with episodes of fever occurring every fouth day or continuous fever tending to be higher every fourth day, abnormal thoughts, suspicion and nightmares.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of predominance and putrefaction of sanguine. This condition is characterised by the gradually increasing continuous fever, excessive restlessness, breathlessness and turbid foul smelling urine.
searchableText: ḥumma muṭbiqa ‘ufuniyya mutaza’ida حمیٰ مطبقہ عفونيہ متزا  ئدہ aumastica sinoco fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of predominance and putrefaction of sanguine. this condition is characterised by the gradually increasing continuous fever, excessive restlessness, breathlessness and turbid foul smelling urine.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of predominance and putrefaction of sanguine. This condition is characterised by the stationary continuous fever, excessive restlessness, breathlessness and turbid foul smelling urine.
searchableText: ḥumma muṭbiqa ‘ufuniyya waqifa حمیٰ مطبقہ عفونيہ واقفہ homotena sinoco fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of predominance and putrefaction of sanguine. this condition is characterised by the stationary continuous fever, excessive restlessness, breathlessness and turbid foul smelling urine.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of predominance and putrefaction of sanguine. This condition is characterised by the gradually decreasing continuous fever, excessive restlessness, breathlessness and turbid foul smelling urine..
searchableText: ḥumma muṭbiqa ‘ufuniyya mutanaqiṣa حمیٰ مطبقہ عفونيہ متناقصہ periaumastica sinoco fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature as a result of predominance and putrefaction of sanguine. this condition is characterised by the gradually decreasing continuous fever, excessive restlessness, breathlessness and turbid foul smelling urine..

longDefinition: A combined form of bilious and phlegmatic fevers occurring due to putrefaction of yellow bile and phlegm inside and outside the vessels. This is characterised by severe and moderate episodes of fevers on alternate days.
searchableText: shaṭar al-ghibb شطر الغب compound bilious and phlegmatic fever a combined form of bilious and phlegmatic fevers occurring due to putrefaction of yellow bile and phlegm inside and outside the vessels. this is characterised by severe and moderate episodes of fevers on alternate days.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature due to viscous vitreous phlegm. This condition is characterised by fever in the daytime with normal body temperature during night.
searchableText: ḥumma nahariyya حمیٰ نہاریہ diurnal fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature due to viscous vitreous phlegm. this condition is characterised by fever in the daytime with normal body temperature during night.

longDefinition: A condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature due to viscous vitreous phlegm. This condition is characterised by fever during night with normal body temperature during daytime.
searchableText: ḥumma layliyya حمیٰ لیلیہ nocturnal fever a condition of abnormal elevation of body temperature due to viscous vitreous phlegm. this condition is characterised by fever during night with normal body temperature during daytime.

longDefinition: A morbid condition due to fat tailed scorpion sting. This condition is characterised by severe pain one or two days after sting, change in colour of skin of the affected site, shivering, jaundice, glossitis and heamaturia. Later it may cause death.
searchableText: gazidgi-i-jarrara گزیدگی جرّارہ bite of fat tailed scorpion a morbid condition due to fat tailed scorpion sting. this condition is characterised by severe pain one or two days after sting, change in colour of skin of the affected site, shivering, jaundice, glossitis and heamaturia. later it may cause death.

longDefinition: A morbid condition due to emmet bite. This condition is characterised by pain, swelling and redness of the skin around the sting.

longDefinition: A condition in which excess fat builds up in the liver.
